revised_title: Involuntary Muscular Tissue of the Urinary Bladder: A Comparative Study
tldr: The author, George Viner Ellis, investigates the involuntary muscular tissue of the urinary bladder and compares it to voluntary muscle in other parts of the human body. He refutes Prof. Kolliker's view that smooth muscle is made up of fusiform cells and instead suggests that the bladder's muscular substance is composed of lengthened fibers with fixed and tendinous terminal attachments. He also distinguishes between two types of "corpuscles" in the muscular tissue.
